alert.note: Alert for Harrison; Shelby (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Omaha (Eastern Nebraska and Southeastern Iowa - Omaha Valley)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued September 17 at 8:21PM CDT until September 18 at 2:00AM CDT by NWS Omaha
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 900 PM CDT FOR NORTHWESTERN POTTAWATTAMIE...SOUTHEASTERN HARRISON...SOUTHWESTERN SHELBY...SOUTHEASTERN WASHINGTON AND NORTHEASTERN DOUGLAS COUNTIES... At 819 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 3 miles northwest of Neola to 3 miles east of Standing Bear Lake, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Half dollar size hail. SOURCE...Public reported quarter size hail near 108th and Fort in northern Omaha. IMPACT...Damage to vehicles is expected. These severe storms will be near... Northern Omaha around 820 PM CDT Neola around 825 PM CDT. Minden around 830 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of these severe thunderstorms include northern Council Bluffs, Shelby, Crescent and Underwood. HAIL THREAT...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.25 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...<50 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Prepare immediately for large hail and deadly cloud to ground lightning. Seek shelter inside a well-built structure. Stay away from windows.
